description: From participle stem of Latin refrigerō (“to make cold”), from re- + frigerō.

verbs.description: refrigerate (third-person singular simple present refrigerates, present participle refrigerating, simple past and past participle refrigerated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete in general sense) To cool down, make cool.
examples: the other [artery] goes to the lungs, to fetch air to refrigerate the heart.

entries.meaning: (transitive) Now specifically, to keep cool by containing within a refrigerator.
examples: Please refrigerate your uncooked meats at or below 40° Fahrenheit.
